elements.name: question1
rows: In the case of a contract for work and services, the contractor owes the customer a specific work result.
The contracting party that undertakes to produce a work is called an entrepreneur.
When your bike dealer services your road bike, they are fulfilling a contract for work and services.
The remuneration for a contract for work and services is referred to as remuneration for work.
A contract for work and services must always be concluded in writing.
The contractor is liable for ensuring that the work has no defects.
In the event of defects, the customer may demand rescission, reduction of the purchase price or replacement delivery.
After delivery, the customer must inspect the work within the usual period and notify the contractor of any defects.
Claims arising from defects in a work shall lapse after ten years.
If a work is defective, the customer may demand that the work be improved free of charge if this does not result in excessive costs.
The customer must pay the remuneration for the work before the work is delivered.
If a work breaks before it is handed over, the contractor can claim neither costs nor wages from the customer.
elements.title: Are the statements on the contract for work and services correct or incorrect?
